notes: This map illustrates satellite detected shelters at the Goudoubou Refugee Camp in Seno Province, Burkina Faso, which hosts people from neighbouring Mali. As seen by the GeoEye-1 satellite on 30 October 2015, the camp contains a total of 2,669 structures within its 235.5 hectares. Of these structures, 476 are likely camp infrastructure buildings, 385 are improvised shelter structures, and 1,808 are identified as tent shelters. This is a preliminary analysis and has not yet been validated in the field. Please send ground feedback to UNITAR - UNOSAT.
